intro: Malvastrum fremontii var. cercophorum, commonly known as the Fremont's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. The species is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar floral structures.
